page.title: 01Uffington-Downland Farms
page.content: The area covered by block 4km x 3km is principally agricultural and mainly cereal foods (wheat, barley, oats). There ae also large areas of grassland for grazing, silage and hay. Woodland, often referred to as spinneys and plantations are to be found bordering the cultivated and grassland areas. The existance of the Ancient Monuments Wyland Smithy and the Ridgeway Path, attracts the walker and tourist. During the summer months the area is teaming with visitors to the White Horse, Wayland Smithy and the Ridgeway Path. The Downs provide good exercise areas for race horses and since Uffington has racing stables at Kingston-Warren, training gallops cover part of this area. The farming community is rather small, most of the farms being tenanted,
